mvcPackage

Class AbstractGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • mvcPackage.AbstractGame
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Game1, Game2, Game3

    public abstract class AbstractGame
extends java.lang.Object
    An implementation of Game-type functioning as an abstract strategy class for concrete subclasses.
    Author:
    Pontus Ellboj

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract void clearTable()
      Remove all bets and cards on the table.
      protected abstract void doubleDown()
      Deal one more card to the hand and than call "stand()".
      protected abstract void endGame()
      Calculate the value of each hand and compare it to the dealer.
      protected abstract void hit()
      Call "hit" (take another card) on the hand whose turn it is.
      protected abstract void split()
      Split hand in two and set the current splithand's turn to true.
      protected abstract void stand()
      Call "stand" on the hand whose turn it is, and thereby handing over the turn to the next hand.
      protected abstract void startNewGame()
      Start a new Game.
      protected abstract void surrender()
      Call "surrender" on the hand whose turn it is.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • startNewGame

        protected abstract void startNewGame()
        Start a new Game. Set "tableCleared", "finnished" and "setDoubled" on all hands to false. Set "playable" and "surrenderable" to true. Set Hand1's turn to true and the other hands to false. If the player Account's balance is equal to or higher than Hans1's bet then set "doubleable" to true. Call "reset()" on all hands and deal two new cards to all hands (one of the dealers cards is turned upside down). If Hand1 gets a pair or two cards with the same value set "splitable" to true.

      • hit

        protected abstract void hit()
        Call "hit" (take another card) on the hand whose turn it is. The hand is no longer split-, surrender- or doubleable.

      • stand

        protected abstract void stand()
        Call "stand" on the hand whose turn it is, and thereby handing over the turn to the next hand. If it's a splithands turn than hand over the turn to the hand it was splitted from. Check all values on the next hand to determine the possible options for it. If stand is called on dealer's turn call "endGame()".

      • surrender

        protected abstract void surrender()
        Call "surrender" on the hand whose turn it is. Set "surrendered" to true and call "stand". Terminate the player's interest in the hand and pass the turn to the next hand.

      • doubleDown

        protected abstract void doubleDown()
        Deal one more card to the hand and than call "stand()". Double the hand's bet.

      • split

        protected abstract void split()
        Split hand in two and set the current splithand's turn to true. Add a bet to the splitted hand equal to the bet on the hand it was splitted from.

      • endGame

        protected abstract void endGame()
        Calculate the value of each hand and compare it to the dealer. Save the result in "gameResult" and increase balance of the player's account accordingly. Set "finnished" to true and "allBetsPlaced", "playable", "surrenderable" and "doubleable" to false. If player account's balance is lower than 5 set "gameOver" to true.

      • clearTable

        protected abstract void clearTable()
        Remove all bets and cards on the table.
